name: src/index.js
content:
export {default as Money} from './Money';
export {default as Currency} from './Currency';

name: src/Money.js
ROUNDING
description:
Rounding modes you can use in your operations.
These map directly to [`BigNumber`'s rounding modes](http://mikemcl.github.io/bignumber.js/#constructor-properties).
examples:
let
     price = new Money('7856', 'USD'), // $78.56
     discountedAndRoundedUp = price.multiply('0.70'), // $55.00
     discountedAndRoundedDown = price.multiply('0.70', Money.ROUNDING.DOWN); // $54.99

properties.name: ROUNDING.HALF_UP
properties.description: Rounds towards nearest neighbour. If equidistant, rounds away from zero

properties.name: ROUNDING.HALF_DOWN
properties.description: Rounds towards nearest neighbour. If equidistant, rounds towards zero

properties.name: ROUNDING.HALF_EVEN
properties.description: Rounds towards nearest neighbour. If equidistant, rounds towards even neighbour

properties.name: ROUNDING.HALF_CEIL
properties.description: Rounds towards nearest neighbour. If equidistant, rounds towards Infinity

properties.name: ROUNDING.HALF_FLOOR
properties.description: Rounds towards nearest neighbour. If equidistant, rounds towards -Infinity

name: constructor
examples:
<caption>Integer as value</caption>
let price = new Money(7856, 'USD'); // $78.56

<caption>String integer as value</caption>
let price = new Money('7856', 'USD'); // $78.56

<caption>String Float as value</caption>
let price = new Money('78.56', 'USD'); // $78.56

<caption>Money instance as value</caption>
let price = new Money(new Money('78.56'), 'USD'); // $78.56 - same as using clone()

<caption>Currency instance as currency</caption>
let price = new Money('7856', new Currency('USD')); // $78.56

params.name: value
params.description: integer, integer string, float string, instance of `Money`

params.name: currency
params.description: currency code as string, instance of `Currency`

name: _currency
description: Internal currency

name: _value
description: Internal value as a big number

name: add
description: Performs addition

unknown.tagValue: {Money} - new Money instance after addition

params.name: value
params.description: value to be added to the current value; type same as constructor

name: subtract
description: Performs subtraction

unknown.tagValue: {Money} - new Money instance after subtraction

params.name: value
params.description: value to be subtracted from the current value; type same as constructor

description: Performs multiplication

params.name: value
params.description: value to multiply the current value

params.name: rounding
params.description: rounding mode used in this operation; has to be one of the rounding modes in `Money.ROUNDING`

description: Performs division

unknown.tagValue: {Money} - new Money instance after division

params.name: value
params.description: value to divide the current value by

params.name: rounding
params.description: rounding mode used in this operation; has to be one of the rounding modes in `Money.ROUNDING`

description: Performs an equality check

unknown.tagValue: {boolean} - true if value is considered equal to the current value

params.name: value
params.description: value to compare to the current value; type same as constructor

return.description: true if value is considered equal to the current value

description: Performs a check if the current value is greater than the parameter

unknown.tagValue: {boolean} - true if the current value is greater than the parameter

params.name: value
params.description: value to compare to the current value; type same as constructor

return.description: true if the current value is greater than the parameter

name: greaterThanOrEqualTo
description: Performs a check if the current value is greater than or equal to the parameter

unknown.tagValue: {boolean} - true if the current value is greater than or equal to the parameter

params.name: value
params.description: value to compare to the current value; type same as constructor

return.description: true if the current value is greater than or equal to the parameter

name: lessThan
description: Performs a check if the current value is less than the parameter

unknown.tagValue: {boolean} - true if the current value is less than the parameter

params.name: value
params.description: value to compare to the current value; type same as constructor

return.description: true if the current value is less than the parameter

name: lessThanOrEqualTo
description: Performs a check if the current value is less than or equal to the parameter

unknown.tagValue: {boolean} - true if the current value is less than or equal to the parameter

params.name: value
params.description: value to compare to the current value; type same as constructor

return.description: true if the current value is less than or equal to the parameter

name: absolute
description: Return the absolute monetary value of the current value, i.e., remove the minus sign if the value is below zero

unknown.tagValue: {Money} - new Money instance with the absolute value

return.description: new Money instance with the absolute value

name: floor
description: Return the largest integer less than or equal to the current value

unknown.tagValue: {Money} - new Money instance with the floor value

return.description: new Money instance with the floor value

name: ceil
description: Return the smallest integer greater than or equal to the current value

unknown.tagValue: {Money} - new Money instance with the ceiling value

return.description: new Money instance with the ceiling value

name: allocate
description: Split the current value by an array of ratios

unknown.tagValue: {Money[]} - an array of new Money instances, resulting from splitting the current value

params.name: ratios
params.description: an array of numbers by which to divide up the current value

return.description: an array of new Money instances, resulting from splitting the current value

name: allocateTo
description: Split the current value by the count

unknown.tagValue: {Money[]} - an array of new Money instances, resulting from splitting the current value

params.name: count
params.description: count by which to allocate the current value (must be a 1+ integer)

return.description: an array of new Money instances, resulting from splitting the current value

name: clone
description: Create a new money instance, holding an identical value and currency to the current one

unknown.tagValue: {Money} - the cloned money instance

name: format
description: Format the current value based on the currency

unknown.tagValue: {string} - formatted money

name: getAmountAsBigNumber
description: Get the current value as an instance of BigNumber

unknown.tagValue: {BigNumber} - Internal BigNumber representation of the current value

return.description: Internal BigNumber representation of the current value

name: getAmountAsStringInteger
description: Get the current value as a string integer (same as `getAmount`)

unknown.tagValue: {string} - String integer representation of the current value

return.description: String integer representation of the current value

name: getAmountAsStringFloat
description: Get the current value as a string float

unknown.tagValue: {string} - String float representation of the current value

return.description: String float representation of the current value

name: getAmount
description: Get the current value as a string integer (same as `getAmountAsStringInteger`)

unknown.tagValue: {string} - String integer representation of the current value

return.description: String integer representation of the current value

name: toString
description: Get the current value as a string integer (same as `getAmount`)

unknown.tagValue: {string} - String integer representation of the current value

return.description: String integer representation of the current value

name: getCurrency
description: Get the internal Currency instance

unknown.tagValue: {Currency} - Internal Currency instance

name: getSmallestUnit
description: Get the smallest unit of the current monetary value, i.e., 0.01 (aka penny) in a USD money

unknown.tagValue: {Money} - new Money instance holding the smallest unit of the current monetary value

return.description: new Money instance holding the smallest unit of the current monetary value

name: toJSON
description: Get a simple object representing the current monetary value

unknown.tagValue: {{amount: string, currency: Currency}} - object with a string integer value and currency code

return.description: object with a string integer value and currency code

name: _addRemainderToAllocations
description: Used by allocation methods to add the remainder to the array of allocations

unknown.tagValue: {Money[]} - the final allocations array of Money instances

params.name: allocations
params.description: an array of Money instances already allocated

params.name: remainder
params.description: a Money instance with the remainder yet to be added to the array of allocations

return.description: the final allocations array of Money instances

name: _preProcessInputValue
description: Convert the constructor input value to an internal BigNumber instance

unknown.tagValue: {BigNumber} - Internal BigNumber instance

params.name: value
params.description: integer, integer string, float string, instance of `Money`

name: _getSmallestUnitDivisor
description:
Get the smallest unit divisor for the current value's currency, i.e., 10 to the power of the currency's decimal digits.
It is used for converting an integer value to a float value (or vice versa).

unknown.tagValue: {BigNumber} - Smallest unit divisor

name: _getSmallestUnitAsBigNumber
description: Get the smallest unit of the currency as a big number

unknown.tagValue: {BigNumber} - Smallest unit of the currency

name: _convertBigNumberToStringInteger
description: Convert a BigNumber to a string integer

unknown.tagValue: {string} - String integer value of the BigNumber value

params.name: value
params.description: value to be converted

return.description: String integer value of the BigNumber value

name: _getBigNumberConstructor
description: The values below are the default but we need a new constructor in case the default is changed by external code.

unknown.tagValue: {object} - BigInteger constructor with 20 decimal places and default rounding half up

return.description: BigInteger constructor with 20 decimal places and default rounding half up

name: parse
description: Parse a formatted money string into an instance of Money

unknown.tagValue: {Money} - a Money instance holding the parsed value and currency

params.name: value
params.description: the formatted money string

params.name: currency
params.description: the currency of the formatted string

return.description: a Money instance holding the parsed value and currency

content:
# Wealth

Wealth is a JavaScript library for handling money calculation, allocation, formatting, serialization, and currency handling.

There are many libraries out there that handle money or currency, but there's not one that offers a complete feature set.
This library provides a uniform interface for various money-related operations. It utilizes existing libraries to avoid
reinventing the wheel.

Under the hood, it uses [bignumber.js](https://github.com/MikeMcl/bignumber.js/) for calculations
and [Currency Formatter](https://github.com/smirzaei/currency-formatter) for formatting.

# Installation
`npm install wealth`

or

`yarn add wealth`

# Basic Example
```js
import {Money, Currency} from 'wealth';

let
	price = new Money('8078', 'USD'), // $80.78
	discountedPercentage = 0.82, // 82% ($18 discount)
	discountedPrice = price.multiply(discountedPercentage), // $66.24
	dollarCurrency = price.getCurrency(), // instanceof Currency
	dollarSign = dollarCurrency.getSymbol(); // $
```

# Documentation
See the [documentation](http://amirmohsen.github.io/wealth) for a complete API reference with examples.
name: ./README.md

content:
{
  "name": "wealth",
  "version": "0.0.1",
  "repository": "https://github.com/amirmohsen/wealth",
  "description": "A full-featured money library",
  "scripts": {
    "build": "rollup -c -m",
    "dev": "rollup -c -m -w",
    "pretest": "npm run build",
    "prepublishOnly": "npm run build",
    "test": "jest",
    "docs": "esdoc"
  },
  "files": [
    "lib"
  ],
  "main": "lib/wealth.cjs.js",
  "module": "lib/wealth.esm.js",
  "browser": "lib/wealth.umd.js",
  "keywords": [
    "flexverse",
    "money",
    "currency",
    "calculation",
    "formatting",
    "allocation",
    "serializable"
  ],
  "author": {
    "name": "Amir Abdolrazaghi",
    "email": "amir@flexverse.tech"
  },
  "license": "MIT",
  "bugs": {
    "url": "https://github.com/amirmohsen/wealth/issues"
  },
  "homepage": "https://github.com/amirmohsen/wealth#readme",
  "babel": {
    "presets": [
      [
        "env"
      ]
    ],
    "plugins": [
      "syntax-decorators",
      "transform-decorators-legacy",
      "transform-class-properties",
      "transform-object-rest-spread"
    ]
  },
  "dependencies": {
    "bignumber.js": "^4.1.0",
    "currency-formatter": "^1.3.1",
    "validator": "^9.1.1"
  },
  "devDependencies": {
    "babel-jest": "^21.2.0",
    "babel-plugin-external-helpers": "^6.22.0",
    "babel-plugin-syntax-decorators": "^6.13.0",
    "babel-plugin-transform-class-properties": "^6.24.1",
    "babel-plugin-transform-decorators-legacy": "^1.3.4",
    "babel-plugin-transform-object-rest-spread": "^6.23.0",
    "babel-preset-env": "^1.3.3",
    "esdoc": "^1.0.4",
    "esdoc-ecmascript-proposal-plugin": "^1.0.0",
    "esdoc-importpath-plugin": "^1.0.1",
    "esdoc-named-import-plugin": "0.0.0",
    "esdoc-standard-plugin": "^1.0.0",
    "jest": "^21.2.1",
    "rollup": "^0.50.0",
    "rollup-plugin-babel": "^3.0.2",
    "rollup-plugin-commonjs": "^8.0.2",
    "rollup-plugin-json": "^2.3.0",
    "rollup-plugin-node-resolve": "^3.0.0"
  }
}
